data.event: Salem was founded in 1842, became the capital of the Oregon Territory in 1851, and was incorporated in 1857.

event.title: became the capital of the Oregon Territory in 1851

data.event: Salem was founded in 1842, became the capital of the Oregon Territory in 1851, and was incorporated in 1857.
Salem was founded in 1842, became the capital of the Oregon Territory in 1851, and was incorporated in 1857.

event.title: covers Marion and Polk counties and had a combined population of 390,738 at the 2010

data.event: Salem is the principal city of the Salem Metropolitan Statistical Area, a metropolitan area that covers Marion and Polk counties and had a combined population of 390,738 at the 2010 census.
A 2013 estimate placed the metropolitan population at 400,408, the state's second largest.
